<<<<<<< HEAD
A discourse of waters. Shewing the particular natures, various uses, and wonderful operations both in food and physick, the all-wise creator hath endued this cleansing element with. I. Of rain-water. II. River or running-water. III. Spring or fountain-water. IV. Well or pump water. V. Pond or standing-water, with something concerning purging-waters. Published for the benefit of mankind. / By Thomas Tryon. Author of the Good house wife made a doctor, Country-mans companion, Monthly observations for health, &c. Tryon, Thomas, 1634-1703.
[3], 24 [2] p.
Printed and sold by T. Sowle, ... London, 1696.
Manuscript notes opposite t.p. Advertisement, p. [1]-[2] at end. Imperfect: print show-through with minor loss of text. Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow Library.
=======

Published for the benefit of mankind. / By Thomas Tryon. Author of the Good house wife made a doctor, Country-mans companion, Monthly observations for health, &c. Tryon, Thomas, 1634-1703.
